column4: Hi. What's the deal with so many kernel updates? I have 2.6.15-26.47 and 2.6.15-27.48 listed as upgradeable.
bug fixes
OK, so the newest kernel is definitely the way to go. But why is the old version also shown then?
shows where?
under possible updates
I'm not sure.  That seems odd though.
Yeah. If i view updates via the GUI Update Manager it shows 10 upgrades but via aptitude it only shows 6 upgrades.
that's very odd.  You might file a bug about it.
Bah, I'm using a custom compiled kernel anyway :P
I believe the make-sans-BE error is 'cannot create executables'
Select the file you want to play with VLC, right click it, select properties and go to the W"Open with" tab.
sorry, i realise just now that i addressed you instead of pkundu
it happens.  no worries.
why don't you use -G [couple of groups] -a?
what does -a do? add instead of overwrite?
yes
Well i didn't realise it would overwrite my goups in the first place. So now i'm trying to get a functional user account working agsin.

admin gives access to the admin group, desktop is a regular user (all groups, minus admin, that your first user was part of), and unprivledged is... I think just login, but can't access internet, audio, etc.  But I still believen unprivledged can still login (as opposed to /bin/false as their shell)
Thanks. I see that selecting different profiles has an effect in the User Privileges tab where common privileges are listed
Right, thats what it affects.  Just a default checkbox setup

Because OOo3 won't ever officially be in Intrepid.  It was released too late in the development cycle (after being delayed a few times).  It'll be in -backports at some point, and the PPA should be back up sometime this week.
LjL: Thanks!
